contents: List I. Pobeda Okti︠a︡bri︠a︡ i ego mirovoe znachenie / khudozhnik S. Starov -- List II. Germanskai︠a︡ okkupat︠s︡ii︠a︡ i Brestskiĭ mir / khudozhnik D.N. Kravchenko --  List III. Plan Antanty udushenii︠a︡ Sovetskoĭ vlasti / khudozhnik A.A. Baranov -- List IV. Germanskai︠a︡ revoli︠u︡t︠s︡ii︠a︡ i intervent︠s︡ii︠a︡ Antanty / khudozhnik D.N. Kravchenko -- List V. Perelom grazhdanskoĭ voĭny / khudozhnik N.D. Kazant︠s︡ev -- List VI. Pokhod Denikina na Moskvu / khudozhnik N.D. Kazant︠s︡ev -- List VII. Likvidat︠s︡ii︠a︡ Denikina i I︠U︡denicha / khudozhnik N.D. Kazant︠s︡ev -- List VIII. Likvidat︠s︡ii︠a︡ Kolchaka i ego posledysheĭ / khudozhnik A.A. Baranov -- List IX. Belopoli︠a︡ki i Vrangelʹ / khudozhnik A.A. Baranov -- List X. Banditizm i ego likvidat︠s︡ii︠a︡ / khudozhnik S.R. Zelikhman.
created_published: Moskva : Gosudarstvennoe izdatelʹstvo, Otdel voennoĭ literatury, 1928.
Leningrad : Gosudarstvennoe izdatelʹstvo, Otdel voennoĭ literatury, 1928.
description: Series of 10 pictorial wall maps issued as posters to illustrate the military successes of the Red Army in the Russian Civil War of 1917-1922. Some maps cover the entire Soviet Union, some cover only the European U.S.S.R., some cover all of Europe, and others cover Eastern European countries adjacent to the Soviet Union. LC sheets imperfect: Annotated in lead-pencil to translate sheet titles to English. LC copy 1 sheets are laminated, mounted on cloth backing, folded; copy 2 sheets are flat, encapsulated. Accompanied by photocopied text: Boevoĭ putʹ Krasnoĭ Armiĭ 1917-1922 g.g., poi︠a︡snitelʹnyĭ tekst k serii plakatov "Grazhdanskai︠a︡ voĭna". 1928 (71 pages copied onto 40 sheets : statistical tables ; sheets 22 x 28 cm). The maps variously include text, notes, quotations, local-region insets, and color illustrations of troop movements and national flags in the map content. "Glavlit A--995. Giz. 24581." Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. 2 copies

rights:
The maps in the Map Collections materials were either published prior to 1922, produced by the United States government, or both (see catalogue records that accompany each map for information regarding date of publication and source). The Library of Congress is providing access to these materials for educational and research purposes and is not aware of any U.S. copyright protection (see Title 17 of the United States Code) or any other restrictions in the Map Collection materials.

Note that the written permission of the copyright owners and/or other rights holders (such as publicity and/or privacy rights) is required for distribution, reproduction, or other use of protected items beyond that allowed by fair use or other statutory exemptions. Responsibility for making an independent legal assessment of an item and securing any necessary permissions ultimately rests with persons desiring to use the item.
